text:
ant seems not to recognize build.xml in a folder, that is mounted from a 
Windows (here XP Professional) shared folder via Samba. ant states, that the 
build.xml could not be found.
Build runs fine, if the project is copied to a linux folder and also from 
Windows OS.
creator: sschulz@ivs.tu-berlin.de

text:
Works for me when mounting a Windows2000 share on Linux.
Can you tell me how the share is mounted on the Linux box?

Also you say "ant seems not to recognize" - What do you mean by "recognize"?
What error do you get? What happens if you run ant with -debug.
creator: conor@apache.org

text:
On ant -debug, the following output is generated:
Apache Ant version 1.5.1 compiled on October 2 2002
Buildfile: build.xml does not exist!
Build failed

But maybe I forgot an important information in the original posting: The Linux 
I use runs on VMWare and not on a seperate machine. Anyway, other tasks can 
access any files of the mounted device as usual (i.e., vi, kedit, make, 
eclipse, etc.).
creator: sschulz@ivs.tu-berlin.de

text:
Hmm, maybe the case get's mangled?  Ant is case-sensitive.

Do you see build.xml when you do an ls inside the directory?
creator: bodewig@apache.org

text:
After some updates to Linux, ant and VMWare I cannot reproduce the problem 
anymore. Maybe it was a configuration problem. I propose to close this bug-
report until the same problem occurs reproducably.

P.S.: Just to complete information: the build.xml was visible and could be 
handled like every other file.
creator: sschulz@ivs.tu-berlin.de
